title: Australia news live: strict secrecy over Snowtown killer’s parole review; AGL Energy to shed hundreds of jobs
summary: Sure! However, I need more context or specific details about the news you want summarized. Please provide the content or main points of the news item.

title: Experience: I dressed up as a superhero for Halloween – and then saved a man’s life
summary: A man was found unconscious as smoke and flames rapidly surrounded him. Rescuers faced a critical situation with no time to revive him before he could be safely evacuated. Urgency heightened as they worked against the encroaching fire.

title: Two million energy customers are due £240m from old accounts, says Ofgem
summary: A regulatory body is encouraging individuals who have relocated in recent years to verify if they may be eligible for a refund. This initiative aims to ensure that those who might have missed out on refunds are aware of their potential entitlements. Residents are advised to take action to explore these financial opportunities.

title: Soaring costs trigger calls to address transport for Send pupils in England
summary: The National Audit Office reported a £415 million overspend linked to an increasing number of children traveling longer distances to reach suitable schools. This trend is revealing challenges in the current educational system's ability to meet students' needs locally. The findings raise concerns about the implications for transportation costs and access to education.

title: UK launches search for ‘town of culture’ among places ‘written out of national story’
summary: Lisa Nandy announced that the government plans to expand the impact of the cities of culture programme. A budget of £3.5 million has been allocated for the winning city. This initiative aims to further enhance cultural and community engagement in the selected area.
